H0.text: Nucleus is the organelle that converts glucose to energy for cellular work.

H1.text: Mitochondrion converts glucose to energy for cellular work.

H2.text: Vacuole is the organelle that converts glucose to energy for cellular work.

H3.text: Chloroplast is the organelle that converts glucose to energy for cellular work.

A4.text: A dominant role for the mitochondria is the production of ATP, as reflected by the large number of proteins in the inner membrane for this task.

A5.text: The most prominent roles of mitochondria are to produce the energy currency of the cell, ATP (i.e., phosphorylation of ADP), through respiration and to regulate cellular metabolism.
